text:
e="preserve">Anita Kert Ellis (born Anita Kurt; April 12, 1920) is a Canadian-born American singer, actress and pilot. She was born in Montreal, Quebec. Ellis became a naturalized United States citizen in 1950. In 1941, she joined WLW in Cincinnati, Ohio, as a singer. Ellis dubbed the singing voices of such actresses as Rita Hayworth (notably in "Gilda", 1946), Vera-Ellen and Jeanne Crain.
Ellis retired in 1987 and moved to Manhattan. She suffers from Alzheimer's disease.
